text: <a href="../1-Samuel-13-1/" title="1 Samuel 13:1 KJV verse detail"><span id="3" class="versehover">1 Saul reigned one year; and when he had reigned two years over Israel,

<a href="../1-Samuel-13-2/" title="1 Samuel 13:2 KJV verse detail"><span id="4" class="versehover">2 Saul chose him three thousand *men* of Israel; *whereof* two thousand were with Saul in Michmash and in mount Bethel, and a thousand were with Jonathan in Gibeah of Benjamin: and the rest of the people he sent every man to his tent.

<a href="../1-Samuel-13-3/" title="1 Samuel 13:3 KJV verse detail"><span id="5" class="versehover">3 And Jonathan smote the garrison of the Philistines that *was* in Geba, and the Philistines heard *of it*. And Saul blew the trumpet throughout all the land, saying, Let the Hebrews hear.

<a href="../1-Samuel-13-4/" title="1 Samuel 13:4 KJV verse detail"><span id="6" class="versehover">4 And all Israel heard say *that* Saul had smitten a garrison of the Philistines, and *that* Israel also was had in abomination with the Philistines. And the people were called together after Saul to Gilgal.

<a href="../1-Samuel-13-5/" title="1 Samuel 13:5 KJV verse detail"><span id="7" class="versehover">5 And the Philistines gathered themselves together to fight with Israel, thirty thousand chariots, and six thousand horsemen, and people as the sand which *is* on the sea shore in multitude: and they came up, and pitched in Michmash, eastward from Bethaven.

<a href="../1-Samuel-13-6/" title="1 Samuel 13:6 KJV verse detail"><span id="8" class="versehover">6 When the men of Israel saw that they were in a strait, (for the people were distressed,) then the people did hide themselves in caves, and in thickets, and in rocks, and in high places, and in pits.

<a href="../1-Samuel-13-7/" title="1 Samuel 13:7 KJV verse detail"><span id="9" class="versehover">7 And *some of* the Hebrews went over Jordan to the land of Gad and Gilead. As for Saul, he *was* yet in Gilgal, and all the people followed him trembling.

<a href="../1-Samuel-13-8/" title="1 Samuel 13:8 KJV verse detail"><span id="10" class="versehover">8 And he tarried seven days, according to the set time that Samuel *had appointed*: but Samuel came not to Gilgal; and the people were scattered from him.

<a href="../1-Samuel-13-9/" title="1 Samuel 13:9 KJV verse detail"><span id="11" class="versehover">9 And Saul said, Bring hither a burnt offering to me, and peace offerings. And he offered the burnt offering.

<a href="../1-Samuel-13-10/" title="1 Samuel 13:10 KJV verse detail"><span id="12" class="versehover">10 And it came to pass, that as soon as he had made an end of offering the burnt offering, behold, Samuel came; and Saul went out to meet him, that he might salute him.

<a href="../1-Samuel-13-11/" title="1 Samuel 13:11 KJV verse detail"><span id="13" class="versehover">11 And Samuel said, What hast thou done? And Saul said, Because I saw that the people were scattered from me, and *that* thou camest not within the days appointed, and *that* the Philistines gathered themselves together at Michmash;

<a href="../1-Samuel-13-12/" title="1 Samuel 13:12 KJV verse detail"><span id="14" class="versehover">12 Therefore said I, The Philistines will come down now upon me to Gilgal, and I have not made supplication unto the LORD: I forced myself therefore, and offered a burnt offering.

<a href="../1-Samuel-13-13/" title="1 Samuel 13:13 KJV verse detail"><span id="15" class="versehover">13 And Samuel said to Saul, Thou hast done foolishly: thou hast not kept the commandment of the LORD thy God, which he commanded thee: for now would the LORD have established thy kingdom upon Israel for ever.

<a href="../1-Samuel-13-14/" title="1 Samuel 13:14 KJV verse detail"><span id="16" class="versehover">14 But now thy kingdom shall not continue: the LORD hath sought him a man after his own heart, and the LORD hath commanded him *to be* captain over his people, because thou hast not kept *that* which the LORD commanded thee.

<a href="../1-Samuel-13-15/" title="1 Samuel 13:15 KJV verse detail"><span id="17" class="versehover">15 And Samuel arose, and gat him up from Gilgal unto Gibeah of Benjamin. And Saul numbered the people *that were* present with him, about six hundred men.

<a href="../1-Samuel-13-16/" title="1 Samuel 13:16 KJV verse detail"><span id="18" class="versehover">16 And Saul, and Jonathan his son, and the people *that were* present with them, abode in Gibeah of Benjamin: but the Philistines encamped in Michmash.

<a href="../1-Samuel-13-17/" title="1 Samuel 13:17 KJV verse detail"><span id="19" class="versehover">17 And the spoilers came out of the camp of the Philistines in three companies: one company turned unto the way *that leadeth to* Ophrah, unto the land of Shual:

<a href="../1-Samuel-13-18/" title="1 Samuel 13:18 KJV verse detail"><span id="20" class="versehover">18 And another company turned the way *to* Bethhoron: and another company turned *to* the way of the border that looketh to the valley of Zeboim toward the wilderness.

<a href="../1-Samuel-13-19/" title="1 Samuel 13:19 KJV verse detail"><span id="21" class="versehover">19 Now there was no smith found throughout all the land of Israel: for the Philistines said, Lest the Hebrews make *them* swords or spears:

<a href="../1-Samuel-13-20/" title="1 Samuel 13:20 KJV verse detail"><span id="22" class="versehover">20 But all the Israelites went down to the Philistines, to sharpen every man his share, and his coulter, and his axe, and his mattock.

<a href="../1-Samuel-13-21/" title="1 Samuel 13:21 KJV verse detail"><span id="23" class="versehover">21 Yet they had a file for the mattocks, and for the coulters, and for the forks, and for the axes, and to sharpen the goads.

<a href="../1-Samuel-13-22/" title="1 Samuel 13:22 KJV verse detail"><span id="24" class="versehover">22 So it came to pass in the day of battle, that there was neither sword nor spear found in the hand of any of the people that *were* with Saul and Jonathan: but with Saul and with Jonathan his son was there found.
<a href="../1-Samuel-13-23/" title="1 Samuel 13:23 KJV verse detail"><span id="25" class="versehover">23 And the garrison of the Philistines went out to the passage of Michmash.
